description: Sum of digits of n written in base 12.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Robert Walker, Self Similar Sloth Canon Number Sequences
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Digit Sum
example: a(20) = 1 + 8 = 9 because 20 is written as 18 base 12.
mathematica: Table[Plus @@ IntegerDigits[n, 12], {n, 0, 85}] (* or *)Nest[ Flatten[ #1 /. a_Integer -> Table[a + i, {i, 0, 11}]] &, {0}, 2] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 27 2006 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n)=if(n<1,0,if(n%12,a(n-1)+1,a(n/12)))(Haskell)a053832 n = q 0 $ divMod n 12 where   q r (0, d) = r + d   q r (m, d) = q (r + d) $ divMod m 12-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 15 2011
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 28 2000
